The bartender in the smaller room was the only one that seemed to care about good service but he takes forever to make a round, and the bar gets backlogged quick.   Aside from that, they made a fundamental error trying to book a private event for Air BnB at peak hours on a Saturday night. We came with a group of over 20 people and picking Odd Job as a starting point for our night out was a big mistake.  They seem to have no idea how to run a bar and simultaneously have a private event. We kept getting herded around like cattle, interrupting our conversations, making us pick up all our jackets, drinks etc. to only move 4 feet, and be asked to move again in 5 minutes.  It was ridiculous.

The manager offered us the back booths in the room since we had such a large group, but he failed to communicate this to security and staff properly to avoid us constantly being ushered around while being verbally harassed. No matter where we stood, we were asked to move again. (Apparently we were still too close to the large room that was completely empty at this point and that was unacceptable). The door guy was a total as*hole to us, and after being continuously harassed by him and the hostess, we looked to the manager for help in stepping in to follow through with his promises. Instead he stood aside quietly letting this all go down. 

We were not rowdy, or rude, and simply wanted to give them our MONEY. Instead, we rounded up everyone and left, feeling insulted and collectively agreed it's not worth the 20 minute wait each round for an "artisan" cocktail and crappy service to ever come back.  

The cocky door guy dared me to leave a bad Yelp review, as he explained that the place was going to be a huge success--so here it is, jack-ass.
author: DJ P.

description:
Super cool decor with really great cocktails and whiskey. Small place, but not crowded. 

Note: Cash ONLY!
author: Jenny W.

description:
I thought it would be a good idea to host my birthday party at OddJob soon after it opened (so soon that they didn't have a website or phone number).  Apparently, I was mistaken.  

When 20+ of my friends and I showed up for our evening of fun, they informed us that they had been booked for private event (on a Friday night) in an hour.  Despite the fact that we had 20 people ready to buy drinks NOW, they corralled  us into a back room to their front room (and larger bar) could be available for the 4-5 people who showed up for the corporate event that was booked. On top of that, their door staff and security were so rude to the rest of our guests who arrived that we chose to move the party to a different location.

Aside from the rudeness of the staff, I was frustrated by the inaccessibility of the managerial staff and the lack of any email, phone, or website with which to arrange and accommodate events.  Their odd hours also made it impossible to visit in person to check the schedule.  The manager, in a half-hearted effort to keep our business, gave us mixed messages about whether or not they could accommodate us before we eventually gave up and found somewhere else.

While their drinks are delicious and the aesthetic of the joint is quite cool, the ineptitude of the staff and the poor business model of mistreating paying customers in favor of corporate customers who have yet to appear leads me to STRONGLY DISCOURAGE PATRONAGE AT THIS ESTABLISHMENT.

In short: OddJob ruined my birthday.
author: Matt Z.

description:
Love this crafty cocktail bar.  Super cool industrial type decor/vibe and lots of booths to sit and get cozy.

I'm obseesed with this place bc the bartenders know exactly how to make me a delicious, refreshing and yet "skinny" Ketel One cocktail or a lovely champagne cocktail. yummy. The best spot for an after work cocktail with a buddy. I also love to come here after a nice dinner downtown for an end of the night cocktail too.

The manager Nate is very friendly and came over to introduce himself and make sure we were pleased with our cocktails and our experience.

Also, a great spot to host a private party.  Thinking about having my next bday party here :)

Highly recommend!
author: Nicole H.

description: Cool joint with great dranks. Thank lawd for Joey and his artistic drink making skills.
author: Israel M.

description:
great ambiance + killer drinks. 
perfect for a date.
author: Angela H.

description:
Odd, yet still quite a charming little bar. 

I dropped by here because one of my friends knew a bartender there named Joey, and wanted to say hello...otherwise I would never have found it. There's currently construction taking place around it, and the windows are impenetrable from the outside, creating an establishment with an air of mystery and, to be honest, disrepair.

But step inside and you are greeted with a spacious, cleverly lit (dark in all the right places) and well decorated area. I went on a Saturday night and it wasn't very crowded at all - our group of six had no problem finding seating. Maybe Oddjob just haven't taken off yet as a prime SOMA watering hole.

Back to Joey...he makes some crazy delicious drinks. We could not stop consuming. The sad part is they are a bit on the pricier side (~$13 each) but definitely worth it.

I'm coming back.
author: Dennis R.

description:
This is based on SRO, so I have no idea what the "main" bar is like.

So based on one experience, yeah, this is pretty goddamn great.  Although I have no idea what exactly I was given since the bartender listed a slew of ingredients I've never even heard of, I really enjoyed the unique concoction that she created.  It was even really entertaining seeing the ways she made other cocktails, and a very strong part of me wanted to ask, "Hey, can I get a sip of that?"  It's pretty dangerous.

The downside is that it's pricier than other cocktails in the city, which says something, but I'd rather pay $20 for something unique (and unreproducible?) than pay $15 for another disappointing Old Fashioned somewhere else.
author: Norman S.

description:
Just going to keep it simple:

You tell them what flavors you like in your cocktail, and they make it a reality, but 10x better. Joey is seriously very talented, he made the best drinks I've ever had and exceeded all expectations with the flavors we described. Plus, he is very personable and likeable with all patrons. Thanks, man! Will definitely return and talk about more late 90s pop culture like the Verve and Cruel Intentions.
author: Matthew D.

description:
Went to Oddjob last week and it is such a great bar!

Yes it is hidden away so you have to look for the secret entrance but its not too hard to find as long as you have the address. Having said that it did take me a minute but I was tired after a crazy day at work!

Once you enter the interior design is really quite stunning and it is a total transformation of what was there before. Filled with cool art and interesting furnishings. There is also a very unique set of toilets with a hallway next to it that also doubles as a photobooth. Hmm that sounds like it could be creepy but it is actually brilliant.

But what gets Oddjob 5 stars from me is the fact that everyone behind the bar has a really great attitude. Although it was my first time there it quickly felt like I was a regular! To top it off the barmaid (Cali was her name, not sure of spelling) gave my friend a free shot upon hearing that we were all there celebrating that he had finally beaten cancer.

We will definitely come back! Good as a hot date spot and good for large parties to warm up before heading to a club.
author: Paul H.

description:
Pros:
- Joey the bartender: highly entertaining and mixed some interesting combinations, the likes of which I have found in few other places
- decor : a real, unabashed cocktail bar!
- novelty factor of custom drinks

Cons:  
- no menu means no prices; caveat emptor
author: Anthony B.

description: I've given this place three chances.. While the cocktails are decent, the staff-- not so much. Seriously dude, if you hate life so much why work in a place where people go to enjoy themselves? Does it hurt so much to smile, and acknowledge your guests? With so many options around the city for a cocktail, it always baffles me when a bar staff is as consistently unwelcoming as those at this spot.
author: Ronaldo A.

description:
Incredible drinks. Great decor. Plus, they have the same bar here that used to be called Big (that sadly closed) where the mixologist/bartender asks you what flavors or concepts you like in a drink and then whips up the most incredible cocktail you've ever had. I do believe it was Joey who made our drinks last weekend: 5 out of 5 stars! 

So glad this place is open!!! I will definitely be back as often as possible.
author: Amy G.

description:
We walked in through the Mission Street entrance (that we were informed later was *not* the entrance despite the door being open--apparently they'd rather you enter on the piss-laden alley. This is SoMa, c'mon!) I had been curious about the spot because there is no signage, and yet could tell there were people inside upon multiple passings. So, when I noticed the door open as we were strolling by, I decided to duck in for a spot. 

Normally, I would have taken at least the time to have a drinkipoo and survey the joint. Yeah. Let's just say that within seconds I felt completely alienated by the bartender. Beyond arrogant, he made us feel completely unwelcomed. So, out the 'wrong' door we went.
author: Alexis R.

description:
I toured california all the way from Belgium and just happened to stumblr upon this bar.
One night we did the regular part and it was great. Good music, relatively cheap drinks, beautifull staff members and comfortable interieur.
The second night we tried the special cocktail part of the bar, with Bartender Joey, and he completely blew us away.
For 16$ you'll probably have the best cocktail you've ever had.
author: Jan B.

description:
"Old Fashion please..." 
Worst old fashion ever. Why is there ginger beer or soda water in my drink? Wtf!?! 
It's the easiest drink to make next to a well drink. Keep it simple. $12 for bullsh!t
Decor: trying too hard. Too many elements. Lighting is warm and cold...!?!?

Please do better. There's so many other awesome bars in the city.
author: JASON L.

description: Went to this bar and I have to say it is kinda hidden can't miss the big wooden door lol but the place is really unique and very Kool place I had couple drinks and was really good and bartender really friendly , if near area again I will def come by . If it's your first time your going to like it  I give it 5 stars and a quick heads up they only take cash only , there is a Atm available
author: Andres J.

description: Four Roses was great, pricy as usual in SF but the perfect drink for a relaxed drink with a old friend.
author: Joshua M.

description:
If you find this gem, prepare to be pleased with creative cocktails and awesome service. 
This review is for the smaller craft cocktail bar to the left that is expertly manned by Joey. Tell him what you like or don't like, the spirits you're into, and what kinds of flavors or other cocktails you're into and he'll whip you up some smooth libations with house infusions, homemade syrups, fresh garnishes, and more!
I'm a fan of every drink I've had there (about a half dozen so far) and have introduced several friends to this spot. 
I'll add that I met Joey when he was bar tending at my fave local restaurant down the Peninsula and have followed him up to SF to visit and enjoy not only cocktails, but rousing conversation and an all-around good time. 
Check it out and bring a friend!
author: Candice B.

description:
SRO Review - this bar is within Oddjob, and not the same

I have come here twice looking for the famous Joey. You absolutely want Joey to make your drink, because let me tell you, it will be the best cocktail drink in SF.

Wait, am I exaggerating? No-I've lived in this city for several years and I've been to the bars around the city and none of the bartenders even come close (I wouldn't even call Joey a bartender, he's a master mixologist). This is my favorite bar in the city hands down.

The ambience, the personal attention, and how much Joey will make sure you like your drink is unparalleled to anything you've had before this in this city. Go for the drink, stay for the experience.
author: Alex P.

description:
I really want to love Oddjob. They are super close to Twitter and I love the space.

But the drinks are hit or miss. I've had some great manhattans there, and some that taste awful.

The last time I was there I ordered a gimlet from a bartender who clearly didn't know how to make it. Came out way to sweet, on the rocks. I later avoided this bartender and ordered from another, but he asked the first to make it! doh. Awful.

If they want to be a cocktail place, they need to hire trained bartenders.
author: Sachin A.

description:
Review for the Standing Room. 

Definitely different than most bars I've been to. 

It was pretty empty for a Friday night, making the environment very intimate and relaxing. I like places this like because it is easier to make conversation with the bartender as well as random people. 

The cool thing about this place is that there is no set menu of drinks or cocktails that you can choose from. You basically tell the bartender what you like as your alcohol base and what your preferences (sweet, tangy, etc.) are, and he creates a concoction that's just perfect for you. I forget what I got but I remember it was somewhat curry tasting but also very yummy... Weird, I know.   

SIDE STORY: 
My friend and I ended up talking to a bunch of Swedish guys about the most random things. One of which included me talking about my single French coworker - which really intrigued one of them. I got his business card because I apparently said I can introduce him to her?? SO FUNNY.
author: Diem N.

description:
What a hidden gem! I live down the street from this place and didn't know it existed until my friend and I yelped for a new bar to visit. The bartender was very nice and approachable and explained all the house drinks.  They were fairly price $10-12 for a house special.  They had very unique drinks and all very mixology-ish.  There was plenty of seating and it was spacious area in my opinion. The place is a little dark, but wasn't too dark to hold a conversation and see your group.   

It would be a great bar if you needed a drink and to relax after work. CASH ONLY. Highly recommend.
author: Bao D.

description:
I was a big fan of Big before it closed, so hearing that they were involved with Oddjob was exciting news. Last Friday I finally got a chance to swing by, and the place has promise.

The space is actually divided into *two* bar areas: to the right, a pretty large one with several bartenders, a cocktail menu, and lots of little tables & seating in the form of cushioned benches and also smaller chairs that can easily be moved around; and to the left, a much smaller bar with only one bartender & a bunch of bar stools. This smaller area is supposed to be like Big was--ie, no menu; you just tell the bartender what kind of thing you want, and s/he creates it for you on the fly. (BTW, be prepared to wait at the smaller off-menu bar if it's even a little crowded; it's one guy/girl making individualized, custom drinks for like 20 people, so it's not really fair to complain about how long the drinks take. If you're in a rush, order off the menu at the larger bar.)

The Pros:
* Easily walkable from BART
* Spacious
* Plenty of seating
* Lots of bar space at the big bar
* Interesting, well-made drinks
* Options (nice, safe menu drinks or choose your own adventure)
* Friendly bartenders who really, really want to make you something you'll enjoy

The Cons:
* LOUD. Even sitting right next to my friends, we had to shout to hear each other. Maybe get some sound baffling going? It didn't seem like there was any, so that might help.
* Cash only. Not a huge deal as there is an ATM, but just FYI.
* All the drinks I tasted (four custom, two from the menu) were *ever* so slightly too sweet. This is a solvable problem at the off-menu bar; next time I'll just have to remember to emphasize that I like a dry, spirit-forward cocktail & by & large disdain the sweet ones.

Overall I was pleased & enjoyed things, so I'll definitely be back.
author: Angela B.

description:
I've been to a lot of cocktail bars, but this has to be one of the top in SF. There's a lot of times I walk into a bar and I just don't want to order the usual, I've obviously gotten tired of it, but no worries, not at OddJob. Tell Joey your base alcohol, and the way you'd like it (spicy, sweet, etc...) and he'll create a concoction beyond your wildest imaginations. If you're like me, and you aren't the most educated cocktail drinker, Joey will make you look good in front of your date.

If you're tired of the same old same old, give Oddjob a chance. They don't even have a standard shape for their glasses! Ambience is great, Joey is great, drinks are great. What more do you need?
author: Peter M.

description: Christian was the worst bartender. So rude. Had us go upstairs to go to the bathroom and then was demanding we get downstairs immediately after. When a curious customer touched the contraption for some tequila drink he insisted we pay $12 for a drink we didn't want. Then they kicked us out because of a health code issue since the pipes were broken and the bathroom is an issue. Well, best of luck to this institution. Good music. Terrible service.
author: Alexandra R.

description:
While Oddjob has interesting decor and plenty of seating, I didn't find the place to be very exciting. The staff was...nice, but the drinks menu left much to be desired. 

The drinks were definitely expensive for the area; the menu offered drinks $12+. However, their Happy Hour cocktail was $5. 

They had this pretty neat contraption, like one of those vortex coin donation bins you see at museums. Except this one mixes three types of alcohols and pours through this funnel filled with small blocks of ice. 

Lastly, this place DOES NOT take credit cards. I checked this very yelp page for that info and arrived without cash. There is an ATM machine with a $3 fee.
author: NickJess S.

description: Joey is a true artist with the cocktails! Hands down best bartender ever. Great ambiance, slightly hipster but it's excused cuz the other bartenders and drinks awesome.
author: Sheena J.

description:
Private event at SRO, the bar -in-the- bar at Oddjob. The decor is gorgeous, drapery and an old-school chandelier; decent air-conditioning and plenty of room to perch around the bar.

They make decent cocktails. The drinks are somewhat -gimmicky foams with lots of arbitrary ingredients and pairings. ("Have you *ever* had mint tea in Morocco? What about 'lapsang souchong' in Hong Kong? Well *I have* and it tastes like this..." etc.) Under the veneer, the drinks were crowd-pleasing with a lot of forward sweetness and misbalance on those bitters he bought at Cask.

The drinks are four stars, but the service is generally poor. Joey is absolutely desperate to be at the center of attention, every moment you spend at SRO. He even interrupted our host's toast. Keep it classy, SRO.

Joey also intentionally "challenges" drinkers by pouring them precisely what they did not order. I would be more accommodating if we were in Topeka or The Marina, or even The Mission now-a-days... However this was a group of cocktail-knowers, which makes the pretense not just rude but a little pathetic. When my friend in the hospitality industry says "no brown liquor," it is not because she lacks understanding. She has a plethora of reasons to prefer a clean, timely gin or white Irish whisky.

It's all a bit much, and there are a zillion places in town that do better cocktails without the pretense. (Third Rail, Trick Dog, Bourbon & Branch, Range.) Sure, you might not get the quirky glassware -- but on the other hand, elsewhere you might end up with a balance of flavors, one that understands the customer and the underlying base liquor.
author: Ben G.

description:
This place is quintessential San Francisco. The entrance is around the corner from mission street and the second you walk in the dark lighting, the artwork, and the bar create a great environment.  This is a good place to chill out with some friends, I wouldn't say its a place to get wild and i wouldnt want to come here to dance. 

UPDATE: Happy to hear they are open for happy hour, great option for after work.
author: Brandon D.

description:
My friends and I were looking to change things up and go somewhere other than our usual watering holes, and this place came into the conversation. I'm glad we ended up dropping by.

We walked in sometime after 10pm, and had no problem finding an open booth in the larger seating area. Shortly after, a waitress came by with a beer, wine, and cocktail menu for each of us. We all ordered cocktails, which were brought relatively quickly. The waitress noticed that one of my friends didn't particularly enjoy theirs, and graciously offered to take it off the check and bring another drink instead!

Fantastic attentive staff here, and it's a breath of fresh air to be able to grab seats and not be shoulder to shoulder trying to order drinks. The only downsides I have to say about this place are that the cocktail are a little pricey ($12-16), and it is currently cash-only, though there is an ATM, and I believe the waitress mentioned they are working on getting their credit card system going. Maybe they're a new, undiscovered hidden gem, but as long as things are the way they are now, I would happily return here time and time again.
author: Morris C.

description:
Nothing I say here will adequately describe how badly you need to visit Joey at SRO in Oddjob. 

If you tell him what you like, he'll make you a great drink, yes. But the real treat, I think, comes from letting him go wild. He'll muddle a yellow bell pepper, or sugar snap peas, or whatever fruit or vegetable called to him in the market that day. He'll add a dash of essential oil or a spritz of smokey single malt scotch that compliments the drink in a way you never thought possible. He'll make you a twist on a trinidad sour with hibiscus-infused vodka (that he made himself, by the way) and god knows what else that's so good you'll want to bathe in it. (Or maybe that's just me...)  

What's more, Joey's a showman. His drinks take a few minutes to craft but the whole time he's chatting with customers, joking around, and he remembers everybody's name and what they like and don't like. He's fun to watch and a true artist with liquor. 

And, to top it all off, his drinks are not only delicious but STRONG. 

Bottom line: Joey is a national treasure and if you don't agree, I'm sorry friend, but you are wrong.
author: Dani W.

description:
This place is pretty alright. It's got a theme going on (Bond-ish, with a couple of red herrings). The decor is pretty cool, and it's spacious in the main bar area. I can imagine that the smaller bar area would be great for a private party, and I intend to try it out.

Three stars because drinks are pretty pricy (cocktails around 12-14) and I'm not a regular enough to appreciate it all. Also, the bartender made three cardinal sins on my Vesper (ratios, ingredients, manner of chilling), which I'd expect any Bond bartender aficionado to know well.
author: Christophe C.

description: Great atmosphere and delicious, albeit expensive, drinks. The bartenders were kind and outgoing. They know their drinks and put a lot of effort into making our drinks. Although the cocktails were expensive, they don't stray far from other San Francisco craft cocktail bars. The atmosphere is great for an intimate gathering with a friend or partner. It's slightly hidden as you have to enter through the side street, but worth the find!
author: Jenny L.

description:
So I really waffled on four or five stars, because it's STILL cash only and it's STILL really expensive and it STILL has shit for signage... But I'm the freaking duchess, so I guess I like it or something, so who the fuck am I kidding?

The front room (main Oddjob) is still middling. It's particularly surreal to go in there while the sun is still out, because you have all this bright illumination from the windows and then all the sepia lamps and mood ambiance. It makes me think of when middle schoolers first try to be goth--"look at my emotions. Look how I have them! OOH CANDY." That goes away when the sun goes down though, and then it's more college guy in a vest talking about Bukowski. So cute!

SRO in the back, though, is more where I turn my head and say "I'd tap that." Just hipster enough, yet also a bit sophisticated. It is completely without a menu, which makes it kind of high maintenance--you have to actually think about what you might want instead of letting limited options determine it for you, and UGH who wants to THINK, am I right?! However, once thought has happened, the drinks are guaranteed to be brilliant. I have never had a drink there that I do not love, and the more I go there, the better they get, as the bartender figures me out. The ingredients are ridiculous, and I love everything about that. There was mushroom something in one of my drinks recently--tincture? Liqueur? I don't know! The cocktails are even more expensive back here, though. I cringe a little every time. Nonetheless, this is one of the few places where I feel like the cocktails are actually worth the price, despite the pain of it.
author: Vivienne P.

description:
Joey is an amazing mixologist.  Definitely go to the small room in the corner where he'll mix you a custom drink.

Came here with a friend on a Saturday night and was not disappointed.  It wasn't too crowded, and we were served within a couple minutes.  Both of the drinks we ordered we fantastic.  I asked for a fruity gin-based drink and I'm not sure what's in it, but it smells of sex panther (illegal in 9 countries) and tastes of deliciousness.
author: Steve D.

description:
One of the most inventive bars out there. 
I have requested and received pumpkin spice lattes, rice krispies, and chocolate/peanut butter inspired drinks. 

Location:
The bar is hard to spot because there isn't a sign (at least, not to my knowledge). Just look for the large windows and fluorescent lights trimming the windows. Don't look for an entrance through the main street... you have to go down the alleyway.

When you enter, bear left. There will be a small room with the owner there. Joey's Room. You tell him what flavor you want, and he makes it for you. The room is intimate and you are forced to talk to each other. It's a great way to meet locals and a very fun, casual vibe.
author: Sylvia L.

description: The drinks are for sure expensive but they're delicious. I got one off the menu, Basil of Baker Street with pineapple, lime, and Thai basil. Everyone kept trying to steal "sips" of it and in the end I had to defend its honor.
author: Rosy H.

description: Nice cocktails.  One of the rare bars in SOMA that aren't overly crowded on a Friday night.  You may even snag a table!
author: Mike L.

description: It's inarguable that Joey can mix up a mean drink, but his rudeness and condescending attitude completely turned me off. He asked what my least favorite type of liquor was, to which I responded "gin". He then made me a $16 gin cocktail as if to prove something to me.
author: Jon S.

description: Good drinks, nice SF bar, but I don't think I'll go back. Here's why: the bartender first overcharged my coworker for her drinks and she only noticed b/c she had the menu open as they gave her the receipt. Then, bartender says "sorry I owe you a round of drinks" for three of us. Immediately after we finish our three drinks, he says "Oh only the first one was free" and gives us a bill for the other two. Twenty minutes later my other coworker purchases drinks and he overcharges again. When this was pointed out, he says "oh, my mistake".  I would beware.  I know bars do this often thinking their patrons might be too drunk to notice.  ALWAYS check your receipts, friends!!!  I will not return.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
This is a review for the main bar.  Haven't tried the much vaunted SRO side.

Pluses -- this is always somewhat subjective:  cool decor (the slightly unfinished look accurately emulates the outer fringes of some Bond villain's HQ).  Relaxed vibe.  

Minor UX faux pas in the restroom area:  the airplane themed stalls are cool, but the handwashing area with faucets tucked away was a bit too cool for me at first.  I was waving my newly soaped hands stupidly and just about to discover the foot pedals for turning on the water when somebody pointed it out for me, much to my chagrin.

Nerd points:  1337 is a pretty sweet street number.

Drinks good.  Ice cubes large.  That about sums it up.
author: Yen P.

description: Awesome cocktail bar tucked away in SOMA. Full of life, character and incredible cocktails. My friend's band, Hickory Street Jazz Club, performs here monthly and the bar experience never disappoints.
author: Caroline L.

description: loved the ambiance and the space but wouldn't order the $15-20 cocktails again way overpriced but good spot for a beer. Good lighting for dates or a drink before civic center show.
author: Briana B.

description: Such a hidden gem in the Mission. The kind of place you go not to be seen but to not be seen. Great cocktails and cool bartenders. We went on Halloween and the dj rocked it. Go early for a chill creative cocktail and stay late for some dancing
author: E S.

description: One star only because I couldn't give none. I liked the location of this bar and thought it would be a good place to end a night out with some friends. Unfortunately, the bartender poured my friend a Coke (and called it a frenet and Coke), and when we politely asked about it they said "well what do you want us to do about it?". Throughout the evening, they were rude and unaccommodating. When I went to order a shot of frenet for my friend whose drink didn't contain any, they told me that I should leave. I have literally never been asked to leave any bar (or restaurant), and to hear this from a bar that had provided such terrible service and quality was very surprising. My friends and I (about 14 of us) immediately left, and will never return. I would never recommend this bar to anyone, in any situation.
author: Marsh 1.

description: Solid bar with great cocktails. Never too busy to feel like you're space is intruded.
author: Aaron A.

description: pretty good cocktails. chill vibe. tends to be a little loud. not a favorite, but a solid choice.
author: Rita K.

description:
Not sure why this has a lower star rating, but OddJob is awesome.  I'm not a fan of SoMa bars, but this spot (albeit hella hipster) is friggen amazing.  

2 bars.  The one to the right you can get whatever type of call drinks  or beer you'd like.  Bar to the left is where mixology goes down.  Tell them a spirit, maybe tell them the mood your in or maybe what you're looking for, and they'll create you an original drink.  They have original mixers too (random bitters, beet-root gin, etc) which make any experienced mixologist a little giddy to see what they can do.

I was fortunate to have Joey create my drinks.  "Off-the-hook" is an understatement.  If you're around this area, do yourself a favor and go to the bar on the left.
author: Brett B.

description:
You come here for the drinks, Joey, and the crowd. This place has by far the best cocktails I've ever had in life. Just mention anything you're in the mood for (alcohol types, seasons, moods, colors, emotions, etc) and Joey the bartender, mixologist, magician, or whatever you want to call him makes something that far exceeds any expectations. Every Time. In the past I've asked for anything from herbal & smokey to warm & Christmas. All have been amazing. That alone would make anyone enjoy their time and come back again to show friends. 

However, what you think might be a quick trip becomes sitting for hours and being alarmed by "last call." While making excellent drinks, Joey treats everyone as a personal friend and puts a bit of love into every drink and conversation. This becomes evident when you hear the remarks of the crowd and how people express their undying love for the place. Any other time this would be considered weird, but after taking in vibe and having a sip of your drink it all makes sense. 

While the place is cash only with an entrance in a sketchy alley, I'd easily go every day of the week and spend any random ATM fee for a one of a kind speciality cocktail to enjoy with great people. It really is a place to unwind and just enjoy the moment.
author: Wilburt C.

description: I'm obsessed with Oddjob. How did I not know it existed? It's a quiet, secret little enclave with amazing decor, great service, and fantastic cocktails. The only annoying thing is that it's cash only, which makes purchasing the pricey drinks more painful.
author: Turi F.

description: Shutupandtakemymoney. All things aside, the pure elegance and intelligence of mixology is glaringly alive in this establishment.
author: Kumar T.

description:
both the main bar (Oddjob) and the bar in the back (SRO) are stellar cocktail bars.  

SRO provides a unique experience of the bartender creating a one-of-a-kind cocktail for you each and every time.  --- NOTE:  SRO is closed on Mondays!  

Oddjob takes credit cards, while SRO is cash only.
author: Karen O.

description: We hosted an event for our nonprofit organization at Oddjob. The staff was super helpful, and prepped anything we needed (projector, etc). You can order food from Jones (I think owned by the same people) for your event and it was all very yummy and affordable. Versus some of the other places I've hosted events (Local Edition, etc) the bartenders were attentive and on top of getting people drinks. The space has a great vibe and space for gatherings - probably up to 50-75 people (maybe more?). Cocktails are fun. I would definitely recommend it for an event - and it seemed like a fun, low key place to hang out too!
author: Colleen M.

description:
Oddjob is always a good time. Friendly atmosphere coupled with interesting decor. I've been twice and have yet to try the same drink. Great value and friendly staff. Talk to Nate for a great group round, or Joey if you are feeling adventurous. 

Bring a group and experience the best bar in soma.
author: Gregory L.

description: Egos run through the tattooed hipsters that run this place. Be prepared to pay $16 for a drink the size of a shot, and literally mocked by their ego. Staff thinks they are the best thing in the world, when they are there to serve us cocktails. For this price one would expect much better service, I won't be back. Would NOT recommend because of the staff treating you as an inconvenience.
author: Peter W.

description: Oddjob is a pretty rad venue. It was a bit dark when I first walked in. Not really sure what that was about. Nevertheless, Grady was behind the bar serving up cocktails. He is a really rad guy and one of the folks who helped organize the creation of Oddjob. Even when we were leaving he was cool enough to provide some suggestions to other places nearby. A+ on the additional value add!
author: Jared W.

description: This is the bar I keep coming back to because it is wonderful. Drinks at SRO are all custom-made based on your preferences. I think I've ordered everything from "something with absinthe" to "redwood forest with a light rain" -- Joey (and sometimes Crystal) delivers every time. Drinks are worthy of the price.
author: Lisa D.

description: Joey. The bartender who made me the most incredible looking, incredible smelling, and incredible tasting cocktail I have ever had. He joked about using perfume to cover the true "wet dog" smell of his drinks but trust me he is lying. Just sit cozy, tell him what spin on a pina colada/strawberries/love triangle situation you want, and be ready for the magic he will deliver. Cash only.
author: Melissa Z.

description:
Bars always make me happy except for this one. The night started out great with Joey Picchi as the bartender (the bar to the left, called PlusPlus, SRO, Standing Room Only. Pick a name you guys! But it's a bar within a bar). I've never met a bartender as vain as Joey which is fine since his drinks are good, but lets lower the ego please. He kept asking me how his drinks were every few seconds, needing his ego to be fed. Kept on bragging how he never tries his drinks because he knows it's perfect (yeah right...saw him testing a few drinks..what a hypocrite). Anyway, I wouldn't have been so upset with all his annoying narcissistic self if he wasn't such a SNEAKY LITTLE RAT! 

We were getting ready to go but we decided to have one more drink to share. Joey tried to convince us to drink more but we told him we had an early day tomorrow. Right before we were about to finish our drink Joey gives us another one and told us to try it. Once again we told him it was good since his ego was starving for attention. Once we finished we asked for the bill and the bill came out to be $64 for four drinks. I was in shock because I didn't expect to pay for four drinks when I ONLY ordered three. Also didn't expect his drinks to be $16 each since he just used Bulleit, which is an average whiskey and nothing special. On yelp everyone was saying the drinks were $12 (was there an inflation within a week time frame?!?!) Drinks were good but not $16 good. Drinks weren't as customized as he said. Joey made the exact duplicate for the person who came right after I finished my first drink and the same drink AGAIN for the next group that came in. He says it's a menu-less bar because he customizes everyone's drinks but everyone ends up with the SAME drink. 

The price wasn't the kicker for me even though I thought it was ridiculously over priced. The thing that I was pissed off about was that Joey Picchi snuck a drink on us. We never ordered the extra drink and if your going to give us a drink we didn't ask for I am going to expect it's complimentary.  I didn't like his tactics and schemes. The main reason I came here was because I'm a fan of Big. I heard Big and Jones Bar teamed up to form Oddjob. Later I learned that Big isn't associated with this place. I wonder why...could be because of  dishonest people like Joey Picchi. I wouldn't want to work with shady people either.

Minus Joey Picchi  would have made this a great place. 

FYI: this place is CASH ONLY and drinks are $16 each.
author: Victoria C.

description: Here on New Year's. Chillest vibe. Girl DJing with a Macbook and a cocktail. Low key electronic music. They had free drinks from 9 to 10, including this delicious thing that's essentially an old fashioned with earl grey.
author: Daniel P.

description: My high hopes were dashed when after barely 10 minutes of walking in, what promised to be a new chill fun space to hang with my peeps in soma went south fast. Staff had a stick up their ass and the manager and bouncer were legit frontin' some Vegas bullshit with no joke attitude and fuck off vibe. I'm not someone to boycott shit but this was not even funny - just lame and annoying.
author: Bryan B.

description: wish I could give a 0 star review. I'm not one to complain usually, and I understand the biz after being a bartender myself for 20 yrs., but the bartender I happened to get every time sucked. was not very attentive. he ignored me the first couple of times I went to order a drink until I got his attention and he didn't give me my change on the last round I bought (I think he expected it to be his tip), so I decided to walk away after a few minutes. like I said, I know the biz and would have tipped appropriately, had I been given the chance..
author: Benn H.

description: Worth a visit just to get a drink with Joey who commands the small bar in the back. He's a true master of the craft, from innovative drinks to charismatic banter.
author: Dav Y.

description: Sequestered in the financial district, Oddjob is not the type of bar that panders to bourgeois aesthetic tastes. The decor resembles and signifies San Francisco's rich industrial history.  The bartenders are top notch pourers of craft cocktails. I recommend the "Drugstore Cowboy". And for those less discerning, pabst tall boys and hamms are available. Ask about hot dogs
author: Chris M.

description:
Save your money, there are plenty of other great bars where you can get bespoke drinks.  This place is a disaster - the managers let their staff do and say whatever they want.  The "hostess?" spent the night trying to herd our group closer and closer together in a corner so we could leave space for the front entrance.  How about you not let that many people in the bar?  I'd think the fire marshall would agree!

The door guy was a complete d*ck.  He kept asking my friends and I to move for apparently no reason.  He didn't seem to take issue with anyone else but my friends and I.  And mind you, we were not being rowdy or rude.

The drinks are mediocre - portions small and expensive.  Don't support an establishment that is so arrogant it doesn't think it needs to treat customers with respect.
author: John-Paul A.

description: Very pricy for each drink, but I guess you can't complain if its custom made for you. Dont even think about reaching for a cocktail menu, It doesn't exist here. Tell the bartender what flavor tickles your heart and the bartender will create an amazing drink for you. Hidden in an ally. No signage. CASH ONLY. Special place if its not crazy packed.
author: Food L.

description: Hidden gem. Nice decor and staff, james bond theme. Menu cocktails are a bit pricey but made precisely and very good tried the Snatch N Grab and Nannie Doss. Clean Bathrooms. Bar on the left has mixologist who custom makes drinks for you.
author: Marvin N.

description: Pricy but very nice cocktails. Nice environment with not too much noise. We had bearcat, briar cliff sling and living day lights and we loved them. For sure, we are coming back but next time we bring cash.
author: Alireza R.

description: I took a group to Oddjob last night and we had a blast.  We arrived around 6pm and there were a couple of large tables available.  Everyone in my group was very happy with the cocktails they ordered.  Even though they seem to be known for their cocktails, the beer and wine list was also expansive.  Last night they were serving hotdogs (both regular and vegan) with homemade condiments.  Our server was quick with the orders and very nice.  One note: they are cash only, so be sure to bring cash.  They have a cash machine in the back in case you forget.  I will definitely be going back.
author: Amy D.

description: Crystal is bomb and so is the bartender with the taste in metal, forgot his name. The drinks here are so good.
author: Noel M.

description: Joey on the SRO side of the bar is the best they come and the crowd he draws is just as great. The rest of the bar isn't too bad either ;). Enjoy your stay, it's worth the trip.
author: Thomas M.

description: Great live music on a Friday night. Not too loud to have a convo. Great date night. Would definitely go back. Even the N/A cocktails are good! Try the Good Guy!
author: Rachel S.

description: Joey (bags/little bocker) is the best in all of sf. A true mixer of magic. Literally the best I'll be back for sure.
author: Garrett Z.

description: Tried booking an event here for 150-200 people since the bar is spacious and they are in the just-right-amount-of-gritty part of town. Everything was going great until the event manager went AWOL right before confirming the event - calls and emails went unreturned in the 11th hour, putting me in quite the pickle! The event manager had suggested the place as an alternative to Jones, which she also manages. There's a construction zone next to the space and there are no signs indicating there's a bar inside, so it might have all been for the better, as we wouldn't want guests getting harassed on the street trying to find the venue. I'm disappointed we couldn't work something out as it seemed very promising!
author: Cynthia S.

description: super yummy mixed drinks, great service, fun vibe.
author: Greg T.

description: I should have listened to the reviews. The shots are less than they should be. My beer was warm and the bartender was being passive when he heard me complain. As he made a drink he kept "coughing" in my face as he was making my drink. Terrible place, wont be coming back here ever. Every drink is over priced and under delivered.
author: Mark G.

description: Great find!!! I especially liked the bartender working at room to the right... Didn't catch his name, but awesome guy!!! Love the ambiance. Only complaint is that it's cash only and a bit pricey.
author: Sonia P.

description: Joey, the bartender at the private section was so awesome. I asked him to make my rum-based cocktail, not so sweet but refreshing. He made it darn good cocktail and he was so entertaining to be around.  I had a good time for sure on top of that fantastic cocktails.
author: Hyes W.

description: Joey made my visit to the oddjob. I just specified my liquor and he created personalized and amazing drinks. Fantastic and magical drinks. He is personable and amazing and the reason I would return.  Nothing but positive adjectives for the best.  I might be a wee bit drunk but it's all due to Joey.
author: Sasha R.

description: Top notch mid Market/SOMA bar. Unique & attention to detail in design. Excellent staff.
author: Christie S.

description: Cool really big space with a small more cozy side bar by the entrance.  Love the theme of odd job random machinery.  Other than that, it's a bar with lots of room for milling and scoping.
author: Melanie C.

description:
You already know this but they have unique and delicious cocktails! Hard combo to do! Love the backroom and spending time drinking something that isn't (soda) + (hard liquor). I know what you're thinking, why not five stars? I took away one star because of two reasons: 1) $14 a cocktail gets a bit pricey for a gal who likes to have more than one drink and 2) they are cash only. It's nothing personal against them, I just have a 21st century pet peeve against cash only places and a personal vendetta against my bank's ATM fees (grr).

All in all, this will be my "I want to impressive you" spot for visitors or for friends that really freaking know their booze. Wish I knew how to make a cocktail even slightly as delicious as they do. Please teach classes! #praise
author: K H.

description: We sat at the tables across from the bar, and the waitress never came around so we had to order drinks from the bar. This place is cash only too, a little strange and cheap in my opinion. It's only 2-3% for business owners when a credit card is used. The interior was pretty decent, but there wasn't much a crown for a saturday.
author: Sharon M.

description: This place is literally under-rated. Went with some friends on a Tuesday night and we were one of two groups there. The bartenders are true artists -- tell them what kind of flavors you like, and they'll make you something amazing.
author: Nishant B.

description: It was a really awesome experience and the drinks were fantastic.  Had Crystal as the bartender and she knew how to make some really creative and delicious drinks!  Joey wasn't working the bar, but he was still there being ever friendly and entertaining!  Honestly a really great environment that I will definitely be going back to!
author: Jason S.

description: This place is amazing! It's a recreation of big in the back where an amazing bar tender will make you a specialized drink just to your taste and a second bar with a steam punk Rube Goldberg drink making machine called the corpse recover machine. So far this place has not blow up and it is still easy to get a drink on a Saturday night but there drinks are too good to stay that way for long. Try this place before it's too crowded to get into.
author: Annie A.

description: I think this place is ok. I live right around the corner, so I'm happy this is in my neighborhood (even if it is sketchy, unlabeled and quirky). Honestly, I think the cocktails are not priced that highly for this city. And I think that they are very good as well. Customer service is always good too. Only thing I hate like many of you here is that it's cash only. This is my only deterrent -since they're also right round the corner from square- c'mon guys!
author: Anca R.

description: JOEY'S SPECIAL!!!! There's no same here.. Every drink is SPECIAL and YUMMyYY! Can we give them a 5 stars sq!
author: Jennifer C.

description: I'm going to be a fan of any place that pops up in SOMA bc when I lived in this neighborhood from 2008-2009 there was nothing. The entrance is on the side off of an alley and when we walked in it was like 20 dudes. My first thought was is this a gay bar? Or a place for techy's to come after work? No joke my gf and I were the only ladies in there. We ordered the James Bond themed drinks and had the front room more or less to ourselves at 10:00pm on a Friday evening.Which is nice if you want to sit and chat and hold a conversation with out yelling.  But I think they're cash only- ugh.
author: Melissa N.

description: This place doesn't look like much from the outside, but it is definitely a hidden gem once you manage to find the entrance. The girls that work there are extremely friendly and very easy on the eyes (go ahead and see for yourself). They have some amazing atmosphere and one of the coolest bar-tops I have ever seen (looks like a repurposed conveyor belt). The bartenders are down to earth and not pretentious like most of the downtown SF bar scene tends to be. The drinks are a little expensive, but its the SOMA so what do you want. You definitely get what you pay for. One of my favorite spots to get "ODD".
author: JJ M.

description: Super cool and unique bar. Check out the bar counter top and the side cocktail room. Hand made cocktails. Yum!
author: Dominic O.

description: Extremely friendly bar. Large space. Amazing drinks. Knowledgable staff. What's not to like?
author: Dan F.

description: Cool space. Good drinks. A welcome addition to the hood.
author: Lotus C.

description: Odd is the word for it. The strange pretension of the "hidden" location matched only by the lackluster and indifferent service. Please go out of business and be replaced by something better soon.
author: David G.

description: Nice lil diamond in the rough.  Fantastic interior space - a hint of steam punk, a dash of industrial, and a whole lotta intelligent design - within a deceptively unassuming exterior.  Was able to snag a booth (not too much seating available) which made for a pleasant social experience for my group.  No seats left at the SRO bar, so we'll have to try that another day.  The main bar was steady with orders, so expect to wait a few minutes (all orders made there, no table service).  We were there between 6p and 8p and the crowd was decent.  Not so many that the standing space was elbow-to-elbow (gross), but enough that it was difficult to hear each other speak.  The patrons were hipster-ish but with authenticity - another bonus.  We all enjoyed our drinks immensely. I had the Funny Game and Smiths Grove.  Funny Game is lovingly tart, and pleasantly sweet, and no hint or finish of alcohol (dangerous). Smiths Grove is sweet(er) and very smooth thanks to the egg white. Excellent flavors.  Prices are on the high side, but all-in-all, we enjoyed the venue as its meant to be enjoyed and imagine you will too.
author: Arlie A.

description: I'm amazed by this two bars concept. Rude service on one side, pretentious 'cocktail program' on the other. It's an awful bar experience in stereo. Nailed it, guys!
author: Kieran M.

description: I was here last night with a friend because she wanted to check it out. We ordered 2 drinks, pussy galore and honey rider. When we got our drinks we were so disappointed. On the drink menu, it clearly stated that pussy galore contained Belvedere. But when our bartender was making it, we saw her using Ketel One instead. I don't know if this is a mix-up with what the bartenders were told to use and what was actually printed on the menu, but if it's not, the bartender should have asked if we were okay with Ketel One instead of Belvedere. Furthermore, one of our drinks tasted like sugar water with a hint of alcohol and the other one tasted like club soda with a tiny smidge of alcohol when you got to the end. I ended up wasting $24 for two drinks that were barely drinkable so I definitely won't be coming back.
author: Helen C.

description: Oddjob did a social event for a technical conference for me, and it was great. They catered some nice appetizer trays, poured some awesome cocktails, and generally looked after us perfectly. These are Nice People and they do a Quality Job. They had good music on, but not so loud as to stop conversation, and set the place up to be welcoming and intimate for us. Perfect.
author: David S.

description: I don't really drink but occasionally have the need to go out with co-workers for a drink near our office. This place was a total gem of a surprise. Great ambiance, good drinks and wasn't insanely loud. I'll try the absinthe next time though...
author: Shane M.

description: The 3 stars are all for the previous location "Bigs" which was 5 stars all the time. We sought out oddjob because bigs had the best most inventive cocktails and awesome bartenders. We came in about midnight on Saturday night and the bartender said she was backed up it would be a few minutes. No problem. 10 minutes later she says there are 4 drinks in front of ours. Still, no problem. 15 minutes later she actually comes out from behind the bar over to our table and tells us she still has 4 drinks in front of us and it's almost last call so we should go to the other bar. Not embellishing. African American female bartender should not be allowed to work with people. I've bartended for years and would be fired (and expect to be fired) if I ever did this. We went to the other bar and spoke to a bartender who said "she's really sick". Gross!  Extremely drunk manager (it was his birthday) offered to buy us drinks but by that point we were over it.  Based on how great the owners and previous bartenders were we hope to try it again and actually get a drink. Hopefully I can revise and give them 5 stars.
author: M K.

description: Joey totally is a national treasure, if I could I would give him the Presidential Medal of Freedom, the Nobel Peace Prize, and make him the Chief Justice of the Supreme Court.  That dude is A+.
author: A N.

description: A group of brilliant  minds came together to create an innovative, contemporary drinking establishment in an up-and coming area of SF.  Visit the PlusPlus Cocktail Bar, and be greeted by enthusiastic Joey the bartender, who will astound you with one of his original infused cocktails! Friendly, professional service is what you'll experience here!
author: Lois L.

description: We arrived last night at 12:30, took a cab special trip with four guests. We ordered four drinks from the female.bartender who was working the specialty custom drink bar. It was not busy only 6 people at the specialty bar besides us and open tables and two bartenders at the other regular bar and about 12 people there. We waited 35 minutes and she still hasn't prepared our drinks so we thought she forgot, reminded her and she said we were next as she said she had only two drinks to make. At 1:30am, 60 minutes after placing our drink order, the bartender said,"it's last call and i won't have time to make your drinks". We were at the bar observing her and she was super lazy and inefficient. We then presented this to the manager a male with bleached blonde hair who was intoxicated/high and he did not help us. The manager sad it's his birthday and was more interested in partying. He said the bartender was sick so perhaps we are lucky she didn't prepare our drinks as we all may have been sick too as we watched her prepare drinks and touch fruit and fresh ingredients with her hands. We used to go to this bar when it was at a different location called Big. The bartender and manager this night were apathetic and have a poor impression. I hope the owner reads this as its a great concept just poorly managed!!
author: Jim S.
